# ML Primer Recap {background-color="#1a1a1a"}

## What We Covered: The Big Picture

::: {.incremental}
1. **Supervised Learning**: Teaching computers from examples (input â†’ output)
2. **Key Concepts**: Features, labels, training, testing, generalization
3. **Common Pitfalls**: Overfitting, underfitting, data leakage
4. **Validation**: How to trust your model's predictions
:::

## Regression vs Classification

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
**Regression**

Predict continuous values

*Examples:*

- Cooling energy (kWh/mÂ²)
- Daylight factor (%)
- Construction cost ($)
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
**Classification**

Predict categories/labels

*Examples:*

- Comfortable/Uncomfortable
- Pass/Fail code compliance
- Design type A/B/C
:::
:::

## The ML Workflow {.smaller}

```{mermaid}
%%| fig-width: 10
graph LR
    A[Collect Data] --> B[Clean & Explore]
    B --> C[Split: Train/Test]
    C --> D[Choose Model]
    D --> E[Train on Training Set]
    E --> F[Validate]
    F --> G{Good enough?}
    G -->|No| D
    G -->|Yes| H[Test on Hold-out]
    H --> I[Deploy/Report]
```

::: {.fragment}
**Key Idea**: Never let your model see the test data until the very end!
:::

## Overfitting: The Villain

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="60%"}
![](https://scikit-learn.org/stable/_images/sphx_glr_plot_underfitting_overfitting_001.png){width=100%}
:::

::: {.column width="40%"}
**Too Simple**: Misses patterns (underfitting)

**Just Right**: Captures true relationships

**Too Complex**: Memorizes noise (overfitting)
:::
:::

::: {.fragment}
**Solution**: Cross-validation + hold-out test set
:::

## Cross-Validation in 30 Seconds {.smaller}

::: {.incremental}
- **Problem**: You don't want to waste data on a single validation split
- **Solution**: Split data into K "folds", train K times, average the results
- **Benefit**: More robust estimate of model performance
- **Standard**: 5-fold or 10-fold CV
:::

::: {.fragment}
![K-fold CV: Each fold gets to be the test set once](https://scikit-learn.org/stable/_images/grid_search_cross_validation.png){width=70%}
:::

## Key Metrics to Know

| Task | Metric | What it means |
|------|--------|---------------|
| Regression | **RÂ²** | % variance explained (0-1, higher better) |
| Regression | **MAE** | Average error in original units |
| Classification | **Accuracy** | % correct predictions |
| Classification | **Confusion Matrix** | Breakdown of correct/incorrect by class |

::: {.fragment}
**Rule of thumb**: Always report uncertainty (Â±CI or Â±std)
:::

## Neural Networks: Demystified {.smaller}

::: {.incremental}
- Just another type of model (not magic!)
- **Good for**: Complex patterns, lots of data, images/text
- **Bad for**: Small datasets, interpretability, quick experiments
- **Architecture jargon**: Layers, neurons, activation functions
- **For this course**: Use when simpler models plateau; document why
:::

::: {.fragment}
**MLP** (Multi-Layer Perceptron) = basic "deep learning" architecture
:::

## Reproducibility Capsule Prep {.smaller}

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
**What to document:**

- Python version (e.g., 3.11)
- Library versions (`pip freeze`)
- Random seeds (`np.random.seed(42)`)
- Data file paths
- Processing steps in order
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
**Where to save:**

- Notebooks in `notebooks/`
- Data in `data/`
- Figures in `docs/` or `outputs/`
- README with instructions
:::
:::

::: {.fragment}
**PhD students**: Consider version control (Git) and computational environments (Docker, conda)
:::

## Common Pitfalls (and Fixes) {.smaller}

| Problem | Solution |
|---------|----------|
| "Module not found" | Install with `!pip install <package>` in notebook |
| "File not found" | Check `ROOT` path setup in cell 2 |
| Plot looks ugly | Adjust `figsize=(width, height)` or use `set_style()` |
| Model accuracy is 100% | You leaked test data! Re-split carefully |
| Too many features, not enough data | Start simple; add complexity only if validated scores improve |
